sections.title: What are Arrays?
sections.content: Arrays in Java are containers that hold multiple values of the same type. Think of them as a row of boxes, each containing a value, and each box has a number (index) to identify it.

sections.title: Key Concepts:
items: Fixed Size: Arrays have a predetermined size that cannot change
Same Type: All elements must be of the same data type
Index-based: Elements are accessed using numeric indices (0, 1, 2...)
Zero-indexed: The first element is at index 0

sections.title: Array Declaration and Initialization:
Array Best Practices:
goodPractices: Check array bounds before accessing elements
Use array.length in loops to avoid hardcoding
Initialize arrays with meaningful default values
avoid: Modifying array size after creation (impossible anyway!)
